segment.source: Create a Group Policy Object (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create a Group Policy Object (Windows 10)

segment.source: Create a Group Policy Object
segment.target: Create a Group Policy Object

segment.source: Create a Group Policy Object
segment.target: Create a Group Policy Object

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To create a new GPO, use the Active Directory Users and Computers MMC snap-in.
segment.target: To create a new GPO, use the Active Directory Users and Computers MMC snap-in.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new GPOs.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new GPOs.

segment.source: To create a new GPO
segment.target: To create a new GPO

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, and then click Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, and then click Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: Click Action, and then click New.
segment.target: Click Action, and then click New.

segment.source: In the Name text box, type the name for your new GPO.
segment.target: In the Name text box, type the name for your new GPO.

segment.source: Note: Be sure to use a name that clearly indicates the purpose of the GPO.
segment.target: Note: Be sure to use a name that clearly indicates the purpose of the GPO.

segment.source: Check to see if your organization has a naming convention for GPOs.
segment.target: Check to see if your organization has a naming convention for GPOs.

segment.source: Leave Source Starter GPO set to (none), and then click OK.
segment.target: Leave Source Starter GPO set to (none), and then click OK.

segment.source: If your GPO will not contain any user settings, then you can improve performance by disabling the User Configuration section of the GPO.
segment.target: If your GPO will not contain any user settings, then you can improve performance by disabling the User Configuration section of the GPO.

segment.source: To do this, perform these steps:
segment.target: To do this, perform these steps:

segment.source: In the navigation pane, click the new GPO.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, click the new GPO.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Details tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Details tab.

segment.source: Change the GPO Status to User configuration settings disabled.
segment.target: Change the GPO Status to User configuration settings disabled.
